intro: Distictella dasytricha, commonly known as the hairy leaf distictella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of horticultural circles.
